cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, forecast to enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Monday night, then curve northwest toward the central Louisiana coast and move inland through Arkansas by Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Vermilion Bay-Marsh Island area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches extend over parts of the central Bahamas, Florida Keys, and western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for sections of Dominican Republic, Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, and eastern-central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, southern Florida Keys, then the U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Remnant low may bring breezy conditions (gusts 20–30 mph) late 27–28 Aug, but tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is inland on the Missouri River, far from any coastal surge influence
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as remnants pass to the south and east of Kansas City late week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized river-rise and barge-traffic slowdown on the Missouri River due to upstream rainfall runoff
